greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: SM(n,m) is the number of symmetric 0-1 matrices of order n such that the total number of 1's is m (n >= 1, 0 <= m <= n^2).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..31, flattened
P. Cameron, T. Prellberg and D. Stark, Asymptotics for incidence matrix classes, Electron. J. Combin. 13 (2006), #R85, p. 11.
formula: SM(n,m) is the sum of binomial(n,k) * binomial(n*(n-1)/2,(m-k)/2) over those k with the same parity as m. To see this consider that k is the number of 1s on the diagonal.
If m is even you want the first formula with r=n*(n-1)/2 and M=m/2.
If m is odd the second formula with r=n*(n-1)/2 and M=(m+1)/2.
G.f. for row n: (1+x)^n*(1+x^2)^(n(n-1)/2 for n>=1. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 03 2011
G.f.: A(x,y) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n*(1+y)^n*Product_{k=1..n} (1-x(1+y)(1+y^2)^(2k-2))/(1-x(1+y)(1+y^2)^(2k-1)) due to a q-series identity. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 03 2011
SM(n,m) = Sum_{k=0..floor(m/2)} C(C(n,2),k)*C(n,m-2*k), from equation (11) in the Cameron et al., reference. - _L. Edson Jeffery_, Feb 29 2012
program: (PARI) {SM(n,k)=local(A); A=sum(m=1, n, x^m*(1+y)^m*prod(k=1, m, (1-x*(1+y)*(1+y^2)^(2*k-2))/(1-x*(1+y)*(1+y^2)^(2*k-1)+x*O(x^n))));polcoeff(polcoeff(A, n,x),k,y)} \\ _Paul D. Hanna_
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 03 2011, based on a posting to the Sequence Fans Mailing List by _Brendan McKay_, Feb 02 2011
